import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

import plotly.offline as po
import plotly.graph_objs as go

df = pd.read_csv("../input/vaccination-data/vaccination-data(26-08-2021).csv")
source.1f5ccb6e: data = dict(type='choropleth', locations = df['ISO3'], z = df['TOTAL_VACCINATIONS'], text = df['COUNTRY'], colorscale="Greens") layout = dict(title = 'COVID-19 vaccine doses administered', geo = dict(showframe = False, projection = {'type':'orthographic'}, showlakes = True, lakecolor="blue", showocean=True, oceancolor="LightBlue", showland=True, landcolor="darkgray")) fig = go.Figure(data = data, layout = layout) fig.update_layout(title_x=0.5, width=700, height=700, font=dict(family="Times New Roman", size=18), font_color="#000000") po.iplot(fig)
source.467b3ca9:
data = dict(type='choropleth', locations = df['ISO3'], z = df['TOTAL_VACCINATIONS_PER100'], text = df['COUNTRY'], colorscale="Sunset") layout = dict(title = 'COVID-19 vaccine doses administered
(per 100 people)', geo = dict(showframe = False, projection = {'type':'orthographic'}, showlakes = True, lakecolor="blue", showocean=True, oceancolor="LightBlue", showland=True, landcolor="darkgray")) fig = go.Figure(data = data, layout = layout) fig.update_layout(title_x=0.5, width=700, height=700, font=dict(family="Times New Roman", size=18), font_color="#000000") po.iplot(fig)

data = dict(type='choropleth', locations = df['ISO3'], z = df['PERSONS_FULLY_VACCINATED_PER100'], text = df['COUNTRY'], colorscale="Sunsetdark") layout = dict(title = 'Number of people fully vaccinated
(per 100 people)', geo = dict(showframe = False, projection = {'type':'orthographic'}, showlakes = True, lakecolor="blue", showocean=True, oceancolor="LightBlue", showland=True, landcolor="darkgray")) fig = go.Figure(data = data, layout = layout) fig.update_layout(title_x=0.5, width=700, height=700, font=dict(family="Times New Roman", size=18), font_color="#000000") po.iplot(fig)
source.66572a49: data = dict(type='choropleth', locations = df['ISO3'], z = df['NUMBER_VACCINES_TYPES_USED'], text = df['COUNTRY'], colorscale="speed") layout = dict(title = 'Usage of different vaccine types', geo = dict(showframe = False, projection = {'type':'orthographic'}, showlakes = True, lakecolor="blue", showocean=True, oceancolor="LightBlue", showland=True, landcolor="darkgray")) fig = go.Figure(data = data, layout = layout) fig.update_layout(title_x=0.5, width=700, height=700, font=dict(family="Times New Roman", size=18), font_color="#000000") po.iplot(fig)
source.3f0b82cb: vac = [] df["VACCINES_USED"] = df["VACCINES_USED"].astype(str) for j in df.index: lst = df.loc[j,'VACCINES_USED'].split(',') for i in lst: vac.append(i.strip()) import collections counter = collections.Counter(vac) most_common = counter.most_common(10) x = list(dict(most_common).keys()) y = list(dict(most_common).values()) fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Bar( x=x, y=y, text=y, textposition='auto', marker_color='rgb(158,202,225)', marker_line_color='rgb(8,48,107)', marker_line_width=1.5 )]) fig.update_layout(title= "Most popular vaccine types across the world", title_x=0.5, font=dict(family="Times New Roman", size=18), font_color="#000000") fig.update_traces(texttemplate='%{text:.2s} countries') fig.show()
